com.googlecode.objectify
Class ObjectifyFactory

java.lang.Object
  com.googlecode.objectify.ObjectifyFactory

public class ObjectifyFactory
extends java.lang.Object

Factory which allows us to construct implementations of the Objectify interface. Just call ObjectifyFactory.begin().

This class exposes a full set of static methods, but the actual implementations are located on a singleton called Factory. For further control, you can subclass and inject that class - but for most use, these static methods suffice..

Note that unlike the DatastoreService, there is no implicit transaction management. You either create an Objectify without a transaction (by calling begin() or you create one with a transaction (by calling beginTransaction(). If you create an Objectify with a transaction, you should use it like this:

        Objectify data = ObjectifyFactory.beginTransaction()
        try {
                // do work
                data.getTxn().commit();
        }
        finally {
                if (data.getTxn().isActive()) data.getTxn().rollback();
        }

It would be fairly easy for someone to implement a ScanningObjectifyFactory on top of this class that looks for @Entity annotations based on Scannotation or Reflections, but this would add extra dependency jars and need a hook for application startup.

Author:
Jeff Schnitzer

Constructor Detail

ObjectifyFactory

public ObjectifyFactory()
Method Detail

begin

public static Objectify begin()
Returns:
an Objectify from the DatastoreService which does NOT use transactions. This is a lightweight operation and can be used freely.

beginTransaction

public static Objectify beginTransaction()
Returns:
an Objectify which uses a transaction. Be careful, you cannot access entities across differing entity groups.

withTransaction

public static Objectify withTransaction(com.google.appengine.api.datastore.Transaction txn)
Use this method when you already have a Transaction object, say one that was created by using the raw DatastoreService. This method should not commonly be used.

Returns:
an Objectify which uses the specified transaction.

register

public static void register(java.lang.Class<?> clazz)

Registers a class with the system so that we can recompose an object from its key kind. The default kind is the simplename of the class, overridden by the @Entity annotation.

This method must be called in a single-threaded mode, around the time of app initialization. After all types are registered, the get() method can be called.

createKey

public static com.google.appengine.api.datastore.Key createKey(java.lang.Object entity)

Creates a key from a registered entity object that does *NOT* have a null id. This method does not have an equivalent on KeyFactory.

Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the entity has a null id.

createQuery

Creates a new kind-less query that finds entities.

the metadata for a kind of entity based on its key

java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the kind has not been registered
